page.title: 14A FARMER'S DAY.
page.content: Mr.T has one of the largest farms in the area.He is past 65 years of age and still works 7 days a week. He wakes up at 6.30 a.m.His first job is to feed the horses and check their welfare.They are not for farm work but for racing. He then drives to the village shop for his newspapers the "Sporting Life" and the "Daily Mail".After breakfast he plans the day with his son and the 'strapper'(a local name for a casual farm labourer.) Today they are preparing a field to receive cattle and will fence it's perimeter.At 1.00 p.m. they break for lunch (a brief snack) and work until 6.00p.m. and that is the end of their working day until the season reaches harvest time.Rains have spoiled the 1985 harvest.13 people work the farm at harvest time.
